dry-run.description: Do not run any real HTTP transaction, only parse API description document and compile transactions.

hookfiles.description: Path to hook files. Can be used multiple times, supports glob patterns. Hook files are executed in alphabetical order.

language.description: Language of hookfiles. Possible options are: nodejs, ruby, python, php, perl, go, rust

require.description: When using nodejs hooks, require the given module before executing hooks

server.description: Run API backend server command and kill it after Dredd execution. E.g. `rails server`

server-wait.description: Set delay time in seconds between running a server and test run.

init.description: Run interactive configuration. Creates dredd.yml configuration file.

custom.description: Pass custom key-value configuration data delimited by a colon. E.g. -j 'a:b'

names.description: Only list names of requests (for use in a hookfile). No requests are made.

only.description: Run only specified transaction name. Can be used multiple times

reporter.description: Output additional report format. This option can be used multiple times to add multiple reporters. Options: xunit, nyan, dot, markdown, html, apiary.

output.description: Specifies output file when using additional file-based reporter. This option can be used multiple times if multiple file-based reporters are used.

header.description: Extra header to include in every request. This option can be used multiple times to add multiple headers.

sorted.description: Sorts requests in a sensible way so that objects are not modified before they are created. Order: CONNECT, OPTIONS, POST, GET, HEAD, PUT, PATCH, LINK, UNLINK, DELETE, TRACE.

user.description: Basic Auth credentials in the form username:password.

inline-errors.description: Determines whether failures and errors are displayed as they occur (true) or aggregated and displayed at the end (false).

details.description: Determines whether request/response details are included in passing tests.

method.description: Restrict tests to a particular HTTP method (GET, PUT, POST, DELETE, PATCH). This option can be used multiple times to allow multiple methods.

loglevel.description: Application logging level. Supported levels: 'debug', 'warning', 'error', 'silent'. The value 'debug' also displays timestamps.

path.description: Additional API description paths or URLs. Can be used multiple times with glob pattern for paths.

hooks-worker-timeout.description: How long to wait for hooks handler to start. [ms]

hooks-worker-connect-timeout.description: Total hooks handler connection timeout (includes all retries). [ms]

hooks-worker-connect-retry.description: How long to wait between attempts to connect to hooks handler. [ms]

hooks-worker-after-connect-wait.description: How long to wait between connecting to hooks handler and start of testing. [ms]

hooks-worker-term-timeout.description: How long to wait between trying to terminate hooks handler and killing it. [ms]

hooks-worker-term-retry.description: How long to wait between attempts to terminate hooks handler. [ms]
